result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey C Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: **POST-HEARING OFF RECORD DISCUSSION BETWEEN COUNSEL/COURT AND DEFENDANT*** - THE COURT ORDERED ATTY FEES AS CONDITION OF PROBATION

Cases 15CF106, 15CF76, 13CM534 & 15CM120 called at 8:54 am [Clerk SH] (Cases 13CM534 & 15CM120 for review only)
Defendant Corey C Johnson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel submits two letters in support of Defendant; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Cheryl Johnson

On Counts #1 & #2-15CF106 & Counts #1 & #2-15CF76, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail (Ct#1-15CF106), with Huber/Work-release privileges for purposes of employment, treatment, therapy and counseling; to commence 3/18/16 at 6:00 pm  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or engage in treatment, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge on each count
--To submit DNA Sample upon request
--To pay $75 drug testing fee (Ct#1-15CF106)
--To pay $300 buy money reimbursement (Ct#1-15CF106)
--To pay $50 drug testing fee (Ct#1-15CF76)
--100 hours community service, pursuant to 961.495 (15CF76 only)
Court has no objection to Mr. Johnson travelling to Florida to attend treatment program at White Sands or another appropriate treatment program

Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Corey C Johnson in court.   Attorney John Rhiel appears as counsel only on cases 13CM534 and 15CF76. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Rhiel indivates that he will appear on behalf of Mr. Johnson on all cases today. 

Initial Appearance held in cases 15CF106 and 15CM120: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
On the Felony case:  Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
On the Misdemeanor case: Plea of not guilty is entered

In Case 15CM120 The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no contact with Breanna Binns or Merric Johnson or Tommy Herman

In Case 15CF106 The Court requires a $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--to report to Jefferson County Sheriff's department for booking today 

The Court appoints Attorney Rhiel as defense counsel is cases 15CF106 and 15CM120
DA Happ suggests scheduling all cases together in anticipation of a global offer.
